metadata.title: CVE-2022-20796 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
On May 4, 2022, the following vulnerability in the ClamAV scanning libraryversions 0.103.5 and earlier and 0.104.2 and earlier was disclosed: Avulnerability in Clam AntiVirus (ClamAV) versions 0.103.4, 0.103.5,0.104.1, and 0.104.2 could allow an authenticated, local attacker to causea denial of service condition on an affected device. For a description ofthis vulnerability, see the ClamAV blog.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-20796` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
clamav-base - 0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
clamav-daemon - 0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
clamav-freshclam - 0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
clamav-milter - 0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
clamav-testfiles - 0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
clamdscan - 0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
libclamav9 - 0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: clamav package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.103.6+dfsg-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
